content: until the stem measures 1 / 2 5cm for the baby hats you might wish to make the stem longer and tie it into a cute knot cut the yarn leaving an 8 / 20cm tail thread the tail through the tapestry needle and pass the needle through the remaining stitches tug the tail to tighten the hole and secure it on the wrong side of work vine choose between a knit and a crochet version the sample shown has a crochet vine 2 / 5cm long crochet these directions would give you a vine 2 / 5cm long if you wish it to be longer chain more stitches in the beginning and follow the rest as is chain 20 skip the first 2 chains and work 3 single crochets into each chain until 5 chains are left work 1 single_crochet into each of these 5 chains cut yarn secure the vine to the stem using the tails knit using dpns for the i-cord might be more comfortable but the circular needles would work fine as well cast on 3sts using long tail cast on method do notturn the work we now have 3sts on the right needle and the yarn is attached to the left-most stitch 1 slide the stitches to the other end of the needle it becomes our left needle now pull the working yarn across the back of work 2 start knitting the next row from the first right-most stitch of the left needle knit all 3sts this action closes the circle and creates an i-cord do not turn the work repeat steps 1-2 pulling the yarn snug at the beginning of each row to ensure even stitches to create the curl knit in the following pattern r1 2 knit all r3 4 5 k1 sl1wyib k1 repeat r1-5until the i-cord reaches the desired length if you wish the curl to be less pronounced slip the stitch on two row instead of three cut yarn leaving a 4 / 10cm tail thread the tail through the tapestry needle and pass the needle through the 3sts tightening to secure thread the needle into the empty core of the i-cord to hide the tail finishing weave in ends wash and block the hat lightly to make the fabric more even and soft enjoy with any
